bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 66 (Tuesday, April 24, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McCAUL:H.R. 5589.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Sec. 8[Page H3506]

item.title: Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2018

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 210.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Examine Overseas Diplomatic Footprint Act of 2018

This bill directs the Department of State, before initiating site selection for a diplomatic or consular post that is expected to employ 10 or fewer direct hire U.S. government employees for at least three years, to analyze options, including consolidation with other nearby posts.

The State Department shall complete a cost-benefit analysis for maintaining each such post for the prior three years.

bill.title: Examine Overseas Diplomatic Footprint Act of 2018

item.title: Examine Overseas Diplomatic Footprint Act of 2018
To consolidate certain small diplomatic and consular posts, and for other purposes.
Examine Overseas Diplomatic Footprint Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
